sen.j: 六郷 政速（ろくごう まさちか、明和元年（1764年）- 文化 (元号)9年10月26日 (旧暦)（1812年11月29日））は、出羽国本荘藩の第7代藩主。
sen.e: Masachika ROKUGO (1764 - November 29, 1812) was the seventh head of Honjo Domain, Dewa Province.
Masachika ROKUGO (1764 - November 29, 1812) was the seventh head of Honjo Domain, Dewa Province.
Masachika ROKUGO (1764 - November 29, 1812) was the seventh head of Honjo Domain, Dewa Province.

sen.j: 第6代藩主・六郷政林の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of the 6th domain head, Masashige ROKUGO.
He was the third son of the 6th domain head, Masashige ROKUGO.
He was the third son of the sixth domain head, Masashige ROKUGO.

sen.j: 母は側室と言われている。
sen.e: It is said that his mother was a concubine.
It is said that his mother was a concubine.
It is said that his mother was a concubine.

sen.j: 正室は永井直珍の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Naoyoshi NAGAI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Naoyoshi NAGAI.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Naoyoshi NAGAI.

sen.j: 子は六郷政芳（長男）、六郷政純（三男）。
sen.e: His first son was Masayoshi ROKUGO and the third son was Masazumi ROKUGO.
His first son was Masayoshi ROKUGO and the third son was Masazumi ROKUGO.
His first son was Masayoshi ROKUGO and the third son was Masazumi ROKUGO.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 佐渡国守。
sen.e: He was Governor of Sado Province.
He was Governor of Sado Province.
He was Governor of Sado Province.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 幼名は尚三郎。
sen.e: His childhood name was Shozaburo (尚三郎).
sen.cmt: 尚三郎→正式な読み方が不明です：Shozaburo (尚三郎)
sen.e: His childhood name was Shozaburo (尚三郎).
His childhood name was Shozaburo (尚三郎).

sen.j: 名は政武。
sen.e: His name was Masatake.
His name was Masatake.
His name was Masatake.

sen.j: 政正。
sen.e: Masanao (政正).
Masanao (政正).
Masanao (政正).

sen.j: 政秦。
sen.e: Masayasu.
Masayasu.
Masayasu.

sen.j: はじめは第5代藩主・六郷政長の長男・六郷政展が政林の養嗣子として後を継ぐ予定だったが、政展が安永5年（1776年）3月に早世したために世子となり、天明3年（1783年）12月18日の父の隠居により後を継いだ。
sen.e: At first, the family reign was supposed to be succeeded by Masanori ROKUGO, the first son of the 5th domain head, Masanaga ROKUGO, however, as Masanori died young in April 1776 (表記の変更), Masachika became the heir, and took over as head of the family on January 10, 1784, when his father retired.

At first, the family reign was supposed to be succeeded by Masanori ROKUGO, the first son of the 5th domain head, Masanaga ROKUGO, however, as Masanori died young in April 1776 (表記の変更), Masachika became the heir, and took over as head of the family on January 10, 1784, when his father retired.

At first, the family reign was supposed to be succeeded by Masanori ROKUGO, the first son of the fifth domain head, Masanaga ROKUGO, however, as Masanori died young in April 1776, Masachika became the heir, and took over as head of the family on January 10, 1784, when his father retired.
sen.cmt: 数字表記変更(表記の変更)→削除しました。

sen.j: しかしその治世中、城下町の火事や大地震に見舞われ、名主の不正から大規模な一揆「万沢騒動」が起こり、事後処理で不正や失態がありさらに混乱を招き、市街地では問屋同士の紛争が起こるなど、その藩政においては多難を極めた。
sen.e: However, during his administration, he had to face various difficulties; in addition to the fire that occurred in the center of the town and a great earthquake, the domain was beset by a large-scale ikki (uprising), 'Manzawa sodo (peasant's revolt in Manzawa) that broke out triggered by the corruption of nanushi (a village headman) and the successive injustice and mismanagement in the post-incident procedures, which provoked further confusions, and even conflicts between the urban wholesale merchants.

However, during his administration, he had to face various difficulties; in addition to the fire that occurred in the center of the town and a great earthquake, the domain was beset by a large-scale ikki (uprising), 'Manzawa sodo (peasant's revolt in Manzawa) that broke out triggered by the corruption of nanushi (a village headman) and the successive injustice and mismanagement in the post-incident procedures, which provoked further confusions, and even conflicts between the urban wholesale merchants.

However, during his administration, he had to face various difficulties; in addition to the fire that occurred in the center of the town and a great earthquake, the domain was beset by a large-scale ikki (uprising), 'Manzawa sodo' (peasant's revolt in Manzawa) that broke out triggered by the corruption of nanushi (a village headman) and the successive injustice and mismanagement in the post-incident procedures, which provoked further confusions, and even conflicts between the urban wholesale merchants.

sen.j: 地震後の文化3年（1806年）には、領内の商人52人から総額1700両余を借金している。
sen.e: In 1806 after the earthquake, the domain borrowed money of more than 1700-ryo (currency unit) from 52 merchants of the territory.
In 1806 after the earthquake, the domain borrowed money of more than 1700-ryo (currency unit) from 52 merchants of the territory.
In 1806 after the earthquake, the domain borrowed money of more than 1700 ryo (currency unit) from 52 merchants of the territory.

sen.j: これは後述の開拓費用に充てたとも伝わる。
sen.e: It is also said that the money might have been used for the after-mentioned land exploitation.
As described later, it is also said that the money might have been used for land exploitation.
As described later, it is also said that the money might have been used for land exploitation.

sen.j: 一方で天明期に、藩士の教育のために城内三の丸に藩校・修身館を創設している。
sen.e: On the other hand, during the Tenmei era, he set up hanko (a domain school) 'Shushin-kan' to educate the retainers within Sannomaru (outer part) of the castle.
On the other hand, during the Tenmei era, he set up hanko (a domain school) 'Shushin-kan' to educate the retainers within Sannomaru (outer part) of the castle.
On the other hand, during the Tenmei era, he set up hanko (a domain school) 'Shushin-kan' to educate the retainers within Sannomaru (outer part) of the castle.
On October 26, 1812, he died at the age of 49.
On October 26, 1812, he died at the age of 49.
On November 29, 1812, he died at the age of 49.
sen.cmt: 没年を文頭どおり訂正

sen.j: 長男・政芳は廃嫡しており、後を三男・政純が継いだ。
sen.e: As his first son had been already disinherited, his third son Masazumi succeeded to the family.
As his first son had been already disinherited, his third son Masazumi succeeded to the family.
As his first son had been already disinherited, his third son Masazumi succeeded to the family.

sen.j: 法号：寛広院仁達良智。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: Kankoin Nintatsu Ryochi (寛広院仁達良智)
sen.cmt: 寛広院仁達良智→定訳不明・正式な読み方不明です：Kankoin Nintatsu Ryochi (寛広院仁達良智)としました。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: Kankoin Nintatsu Ryochi (寛広院仁達良智)
Posthumous Buddhist name: Kankoin Nintatsu Ryochi (寛広院仁達良智)

sen.j: 墓所：東京都台東区西浅草の万隆寺。
sen.e: Grave: Manryu-ji Temple in Nishi-Asakusa, Taito Ward, Tokyo.
Grave: Manryu-ji Temple in Nishi-Asakusa, Taito Ward, Tokyo.
Grave: Manryu-ji Temple in Nishi-Asakusa, Taito Ward, Tokyo.

sen.j: 象潟開発
sen.e: Exploitation of Kisakata
sen.cmt: 象潟開発→exploitation of Kisakataとしました。
sen.e: Exploitation of Kisakata
Exploitation of Kisakata

sen.j: 松尾芭蕉が『奥の細道』でも訪れた「遠浅の海に小島が浮かぶ」九十九島・八十八潟の景勝地・本荘藩領の象潟はしかし、前述の鳥海大地震(象潟地震)により隆起し、「広々とした陸地に小山が点在する」風景となってしまった。
sen.e: Kisakata located in the Honjo Domain was famous for its picturesque view consisting of Tsukumo-jima Islands and Yasohachi-gata Lagoon, which was depicted as 'small islands floating in the sea with shoals' and where Basho MATSUO also visited on his journey of "Oku no Hosomichi" (The Narrow Road to the Deep North), however, Kisakata was upthrusted by the above mentioned great Chokai earthquake (Kisakata Earthquake) and changed into 'an extensive land with scattered mounds.'
sen.cmt: 「遠浅の海に小島が浮かぶ」→定訳不明：'small islands floating in the sea with shoals' としました。 「広々とした陸地に小山が点在する」→定訳不明：'an extensive land with scattered mounds'としました。
sen.e: Kisakata located in the Honjo Domain was famous for its picturesque view consisting of Tsukumo-jima Islands and Yasohachi-gata Lagoon, which was depicted as 'small islands floating in the sea with shoals' and where Basho MATSUO also visited on his journey of "Oku no Hosomichi" (The Narrow Road to the Deep North), however, Kisakata was uprooted by the above mentioned great Chokai earthquake (Kisakata Earthquake) and changed into 'an extensive land with scattered mounds.'

Kisakata located in the Honjo Domain was famous for its picturesque view consisting of Tsukumo-jima Islands and Yasohachi-gata Lagoon, which was depicted as 'small islands floating in the sea with shoals' and where Basho MATSUO also visited on his journey of "Oku no Hosomichi" (The Narrow Road to the Deep North), however, Kisakata was uprooted by the above mentioned great Chokai earthquake (Kisakata Earthquake) and changed into 'an extensive land with scattered mounds.'

sen.j: それまでは景勝地として大事にし、島守という役人を置くなどしていた本荘藩ではあったが、藩はこれを逆転の発想で好機と捉えた。
sen.e: The Honjo Domain that was making efforts until then to maintain its picturesque view, placing an officer called Shimamori (guards of the island), tried to look this change from a different angle and took it as a chance.

The Honjo Domain that was making efforts until then to maintain its picturesque view, placing an officer called Shimamori (guards of the island), tried to look this change from a different angle and took it as an opportunity.

The Honjo Domain that was making efforts until then to maintain its picturesque view, placing an officer called Shimamori (guards of the island), tried to look this change from a different angle and took it as an opportunity.

sen.j: つまり、未開拓の広大な平原が出現したわけである。
sen.e: That is to say, an extensive and unexploited plain land had emerged.
In short, an extensive and unexploited plain land had emerged.
sen.cmt: "That is to say" - "in short". I thought this would read more naturally.
sen.e: In short, an extensive and unexploited plain land had emerged.

sen.j: 資金を集めた藩は地震より数年後から、干拓農地化事業に着手する。
sen.e: The domain, after having raised the fund, launched the land reclamation project several years after the earthquake to make it an arable land
sen.cmt: 干拓農地化事業→the land reclamation project to make it an arable land としました。
sen.e: The domain, after having raised the fund, launched the land reclamation project several years after the earthquake to make it an arable land
The domain, after having raised the fund, launched the land reclamation project several years after the earthquake to make it an arable land

sen.j: 当初は小山（元・島）を全て潰し、その残土や刈り出した松の木を使って広大な農地を開発する予定であったが、地元の名刹・蚶満寺住職の覚林が景勝地の開拓に反対運動を始めた。
sen.e: At the outset of the project, the domain intended to planarize the land, leveling completely the mounds (those were islands before), and the surplus earth and the logged pine trees were to be utilized to develop a vast agricultural land, however, the chief priest named Kakurin of Kanman-ji Temple, a local famous temple with a long history, began an opposition campaign.

At the outset of the project, the domain intended to planarize the land, completely leveling the mounds (that were islands before), and the surplus earth and the logged pine trees were to be utilized to develop a vast agricultural land, however, the chief priest named Kakurin of Kanman-ji Temple, a local famous temple with a long history, began an opposition campaign.
sen.cmt: "Leveling completely" - "completely levelling". I thought this was a little smoother. Also changed "those" to "that"
sen.e: At the outset of the project, the domain intended to planarize the land, completely leveling the mounds (that were islands before), and the surplus earth and the logged pine trees were to be utilized to develop a vast agricultural land, however, the chief priest named Kakurin of Kanman-ji Temple, a local famous temple with a long history, began an opposition campaign.

sen.j: 藩が自分の主張を受け入れないとみた覚林は京に赴き、閑院宮家を動かし、蚶満寺を祈祷所としてもらい、朝廷の権威を背景に反対運動を展開した。
sen.e: To see that the domain would not accept his claim, Kakurin went up to Kyoto and lobbied the Kaninnomiya family to get Kanman-ji Temple designated as an oratory, and promoted the opposition campaign backed by the authority of the Imperial Court.

To see that the domain would not accept his claim, Kakurin went up to Kyoto and lobbied the Kaninnomiya family to get Kanman-ji Temple designated as an oratory, and promoted the opposition campaign backed by the authority of the Imperial Court.

To see that the domain would not accept his claim, Kakurin went up to Kyoto and lobbied the Kaninnomiya family to get Kanman-ji Temple designated as an oratory, and promoted the opposition campaign backed by the authority of the Imperial Court.

sen.j: これにより藩は、蚶満寺や覚林に公然と手出しができなくなった。
sen.e: In that circumstances, the domain was capable to openly intervene neither to Kanman-ji Temple nor to Kakurin.
In that circumstance, the domain was incapable of openly intervening to neither Kanman-ji Temple or Kakurin.
In that circumstance, the domain was incapable of openly intervening to neither Kanman-ji Temple or Kakurin.

sen.j: 新田開発を進めたい藩は、江戸に出ていた覚林を捕縛、僧侶ではなく俗名勘助という名目で獄中の人とし、覚林は獄中にて獄死した。
sen.e: However, the domain, which wanted to promote new land development, detained Kakurin while he was in Edo (the current Tokyo) and incarcerated him as a laic figure popularly called Kansuke, and Kakurin died in prison.
sen.cmt: 俗名勘助という名目で→as a laic figure popularly called Kansukeとしました。
sen.e: However, the domain, which wanted to promote new land development, detained Kakurin while he was in Edo (the current Tokyo) and incarcerated him as a laic figure popularly called Kansuke, and Kakurin died in prison.

However, the domain, which wanted to promote new land development, detained Kakurin while he was in Edo (the current Tokyo) and incarcerated him as a laic figure popularly called Kansuke, and Kakurin died in prison.

sen.j: これにより藩の開拓事業は進行するのだが、小山の主だったものは残された。
sen.e: Since then, the domain's exploitation project made advancement but most of the mounds were left untouched.
Since then, the domain's exploitation project made advancement but most of the mounds were left untouched.
Since then, the domain's exploitation project made advancement but most of the mounds were left untouched.

sen.j: 覚林の祟りを恐れたとも、単に金銭や手間上の都合、とも言われている。
sen.e: It is said that it was because the people were afraid of Kakurin's curse or it was the question of saving money and troublesome work.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is said that it was because the people were afraid of Kakurin's curse or it was the question of saving money and troublesome work.
It is said that it was because the people were afraid of Kakurin's curse or it was the question of saving money and troublesome work.

sen.j: とにかく今日の「田園風景の中に島のように小山が点在する」名勝象潟が残った。
sen.e: In any case, the famous picturesque view of Kisakata has remained as described today as 'the hills scattered as if they were islands in the country view.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 「田園風景の中に島のように小山が点在する」→定訳不明： 'the hills scattered as if they were islands in the country view.'
sen.e: In any case, the famous picturesque view of Kisakata has remained as described today as 'the hills scattered as if they were islands in the country view.'
In any case, the famous picturesque view of Kisakata has remained as described today as 'the hills scattered as if they were islands in the country view.'
